messages: eb3591ed42e141cb080acd4e7b2e7f4e (13:40): i have a problem  when i try to connect on the server oracle i have this error message ORA-12162: TNS:net service name is incorrectly specified
eb3591ed42e141cb080acd4e7b2e7f4e (13:42): when i write lsnrctl start  i have TNS-01106: Listener using listener name LISTENER has already been started
eb3591ed42e141cb080acd4e7b2e7f4e (13:42): can anybody help me please very thanks
77c3a0bc6be31167242711da28ee70d0 (13:47): please make sure that you do not have a tnslsnr process running.
77c3a0bc6be31167242711da28ee70d0 (13:47): Which OS do you use, kikim?
eb3591ed42e141cb080acd4e7b2e7f4e (14:06): usn:  i  have  oracle   21932  0.0  0.7  37496  3920 ?        Ssl  09:53   0:00 /home/oracle/oracle/product/10.2.0/db_1/bin/tnslsnr LISTENER -inherit
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (14:07): kikim: whats the command that gives you the tns error?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (14:07): sqlplus user/pass@name_of_the_local_sid?
eb3591ed42e141cb080acd4e7b2e7f4e (14:09): sqlplus  "sys/*****@test.tst@orcl"
eb3591ed42e141cb080acd4e7b2e7f4e (14:09): when i make the installation of oracle i create the database orcl
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (14:10): you don't specify the instance like that on a local machine
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (14:10): you export ORACLE_SID
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (14:10): export ORACLE_SID=orcl
eb3591ed42e141cb080acd4e7b2e7f4e (14:10): if i write sqlplus "sys/****@127.0.0.1 as sysdba" i have the same problem
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (14:11): and what the heck is that syntax about anyway?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (14:11): you do user/password@tnsalisa
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (14:11): and the tns alias needs to specified in tnsnames.ora or .tnsnames.ora
eb3591ed42e141cb080acd4e7b2e7f4e (14:11): ERROR:
eb3591ed42e141cb080acd4e7b2e7f4e (14:11): ORA-01034: ORACLE not available
eb3591ed42e141cb080acd4e7b2e7f4e (14:11): ORA-27101: shared memory realm does not exist
eb3591ed42e141cb080acd4e7b2e7f4e (14:11): Linux Error: 2: No such file or directory
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (14:11): then oracle is not starte
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (14:12): try as sysdba and you should get "Connected to idle instance"
eb3591ed42e141cb080acd4e7b2e7f4e (14:13): when i try with sysdba i have the same error
eb3591ed42e141cb080acd4e7b2e7f4e (14:13): i try  this command sqlplus "sys/****@127.0.0.1 as sysdba"
eb3591ed42e141cb080acd4e7b2e7f4e (14:13): hali: oracle is not started???
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (14:13): didn't i just write that that syntax is wrong!
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (14:14): sqlplus "/ as sysdba"
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (14:14): or if you are russian you may skip the quotes ;)
eb3591ed42e141cb080acd4e7b2e7f4e (14:15): hali:  i am not russian :)
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (14:15): just a joke to hell
eb3591ed42e141cb080acd4e7b2e7f4e (14:15): hali: sqlplus "/ as sysdba" i have  Connected to an idle instance.
eb3591ed42e141cb080acd4e7b2e7f4e (14:15): SQL>
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (14:15): if you are sure you have entered the correct ORACLE_SID
eb3591ed42e141cb080acd4e7b2e7f4e (14:17): hali: SQL> select * from v$version;
eb3591ed42e141cb080acd4e7b2e7f4e (14:17): BANNER
eb3591ed42e141cb080acd4e7b2e7f4e (14:17): Oracle Database 10g Release 10.2.0.1.0 - Production
eb3591ed42e141cb080acd4e7b2e7f4e (14:17): good :)
eb3591ed42e141cb080acd4e7b2e7f4e (14:18): hali: i think it work :)
eb3591ed42e141cb080acd4e7b2e7f4e (14:20): hali: can i send you a present for your help please :)
